intro: Parinari rigida, commonly known as the hard-wood tree or African satinwood, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its dense, hard wood that is highly valued for its durability and fine grain. The tree typically grows in lowland rainforests and has simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by round, smooth fruits that contain a single seed. The plant is also noted for its ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
